intro: Parsonsia constricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parsonsia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slight indentation at the base. Parsonsia constricta is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
